The display has a CRT-like glow effect, but it's not simulated through shaders; rather, it's entirely natural and looโฆ

title: ASRock X870 Taichi Creator Review: A Taichi for Creatives
summary: ASRockโs X870 Taichi Creator is a good, sub-$320 AM5 motherboard. Its strong all-around performance and creator-focused features - like 10 GbE, ample slot spacing/dual PCIe 5.0 slots, and numerous USB ports- make it a top mid-range option, especially for those who need a lot of expandability

title: Slot frustrated as Liverpool set to lose Isak for 'long time'
summary: Liverpool manager Arne Slot says he expects to lose Alexander Isak for "a couple of months" after the striker was injured in a tackle by Tottenham's Micky van de Ven - a challenge that Slot has called "reckless".

title: 'It's a fascinating time' - Ainslie on America's Cup new alliance
summary: Sir Ben Ainslie says a new sailing partnership between the five founding members of the America's Cup, which includes Great Britain's Athena Racing, will revamp and commercialise the event, whilst also making the competition a better event for supporters to watch.

title: How England lost the Ashes in five charts
summary: It took England just 11 days of cricket to lose the Ashes to Australia - BBC Sport looks at five charts that show why the hosts have gone 3-0 up after three Tests.

title: I'm not retiring, I'm evolving - Kipchoge
summary: The Kenyan marathoner has all the running accolades he needs but is now focusing on new goals.

title: Purdy keeps alive 49ers title push in win over Colts
summary: Quarterback Brock Purdy throws a career-high five touchdown passes as San Francisco 49ers win 48-27 against Indianapolis Colts to keep alive their NFC West title hopes.

title: 'We didn't get it right' - Key sorry for Ashes display
summary: Director of cricket Rob Key says he is "gutted, disappointed and sorry" regarding England's dismal Ashes performance - the series having been lost with two Tests still to play.

summary: Liverpool might score a hatful at home to Wolves this week and it would be rude not to get at least one attacking asset in your FPL team, writes Thomas Woods.

summary: Raul Jimenez's first-half penalty proves enough for Fulham to get their Premier League season back on track with a hard-fought win at home to Nottingham Forest.
